input: Anne is furry. Anne is kind. Charlie is kind. Gary is big. Gary is furry. Gary is rough. Gary is smart. Harry is big. Harry is blue. Harry is furry. Harry is kind. Harry is rough. Harry is smart. Harry is young. All young things are smart. If Gary is furry then Gary is big. Smart things are big. If Gary is big and Gary is young then Gary is kind. If something is furry then it is young. If something is big then it is rough. If something is kind and big then it is rough. Kind things are furry. If something is big and blue then it is furry. Question: Charlie is rough.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Furry Anne
axiom T2 : Kind Anne
axiom T3 : Kind Charlie
axiom T4 : Big Gary
axiom T5 : Furry Gary
axiom T6 : Rough Gary
axiom T7 : Smart Gary
axiom T8 : Big Harry
axiom T9 : Blue Harry
axiom T10 : Furry Harry
axiom T11 : Kind Harry
axiom T12 : Rough Harry
axiom T13 : Smart Harry
axiom T14 : Young Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Smart x
axiom R2 : Furry Gary → Big Gary
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Big x
axiom R4 : Big Gary ∧ Young Gary → Kind Gary
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Young x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Rough x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Big x → Rough x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Furry x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Big x ∧ Blue x → Furry x

theorem charlie_is_rough : Rough Charlie :=
begin
  apply R7,
  split,
  exact T3,
  apply R3,
  apply R1,
  apply R5,
  apply R8,
  exact T3,
end

-- The answer is True
